Azure App Testing services that include Azure Load Testing and Playwright Workspaces for testing applications at scale with high-scale loads and end-to-end test automation.
Load testing service for Azure applications.
Manages and enforces security policies across Azure resources.
Provides insight into your current security state and recommends actions.
Azure SRE Agent is an AI-powered reliability assistant that helps teams diagnose and resolve production issues, reduce operational toil, and lower mean time to resolution
A simple fake data generator for .NET languages like C#, F# and VB.NET. Fundamentally a C# port of faker.js and inspired by FluentValidation's syntax sugar.
CLI tool for running Bruno collections.
Platform for chaos engineering and testing.

Checkmarx is an Application Security Testing (AppSec) platform that helps organizations identify and fix vulnerabilities in source code early in the software development lifecycle. It supports a DevSecOps approach, integrating security into CI/CD pipelines to prevent security flaws before production.

Find and fix defects in your Java, C/C++, C#, JavaScript, Ruby, or Python open source project for free. Test every line of code and potential execution path. The root cause of each defect is clearly explained, making it easy to fix bugs

Scans files for commonly found types of credentials like default passwords, SQL connection strings and Certificates with private keys. The CredScan build task is included in the Microsoft Security Code Analysis Extension. This page has the steps needed to configure & run the build task as part of your build definition.

Built for front-end developers with a strong focus on simplicity and real-time debugging.
Runs inside the browser, giving direct access to DOM and network layer.
Ideal for JavaScript/TypeScript projects.
API security solution for protecting APIs.
Checks Bicep and ARM files for API security misconfigurations.
a framework of IDE extensions and language analyzers that provide inline security analysis in the dev environment as the developer writes code.

Solution designed to help organizations improve productivity, strengthen security, and meet compliance and regulatory requirements. It automates identity and access processes, ensuring that the right people have the right access to the right resources

Faker is a Python package that generates fake data for you. Whether you need to bootstrap your database, create good-looking XML documents, fill-in your persistence to stress test it, or anonymize data taken from a production service, Faker is for you.

Testing Style: Property-based testing
Goal: Discover edge cases and verify general properties
How It Works: Generates random inputs to test if properties always hold
This allows you to write your own custom query to detect vulnerabilities in your code
Toolkit to help you get started with Spec-Driven Development

popular tool for load testing and performance testing. It is a Java application that allows you to test the performance of various services, including web applications, databases, and more. JMeter can simulate a heavy load on a server, group of servers, network, or object to test its strength or analyze overall performance under different load types

k6 is an open-source load testing tool designed for modern engineering teams. It allows you to conduct high throughput performance tests and is particularly developer-friendly, integrating well with CI/CD pipelines. k6 uses JavaScript for scripting, making it accessible for developers who are already familiar with the language. It supports various types of tests, including stress tests, spike tests, soak tests, and smoke tests
Traces, evals, prompt management and metrics to debug and improve your LLM application. Open source LLM engineering platform for observability, prompt management, evaluation, and analytics.

Automated security and compliance for open source.

MsTest is a testing framework provided by Microsoft for the .NET ecosystem. It enables developers to write and run automated tests—including unit tests and integration tests—for their applications. MsTest is fully integrated into Visual Studio, Visual Studio Code, the .NET CLI, and many CI/CD pipelines, making it a popular and accessible choice for .NET developers.

NBomber - Distributed load-testing framework for .NET. It is designed to test any system regardless of the protocol (HTTP/WebSockets/AMQP) or a semantic model (Pull/Push). It allows to write distributed load test scenarios in plain C# or F#.

Neubird provides an agentic AI-powered SRE (Site Reliability Engineering) assistant/engineer that uses GenAI to help IT Operations (ITOps / SRE / incident response / monitoring). Their solution ingests large volumes of observability data (logs, traces, metrics) to detect anomalies, diagnose issues, and suggest remediation. Neubird has helped clients reduce time-to-resolve (MTTR) by up to 90%, improve detection, perform root cause analysis, and automate parts of incident diagnosis and resolution in complex cloud-native / telemetry-rich environments.

NSubstitute is a mocking framework for .NET that simplifies creating test doubles (mocks, stubs, fakes) for unit testing. It is designed with Arrange-Act-Assert (AAA) and Test-Driven Development (TDD) in mind, providing a clean, intuitive syntax for defining behavior and verifying interactions in tests

NUnit is an open-source unit testing framework for .NET languages (primarily C#). It belongs to the xUnit family of testing frameworks (like JUnit for Java) and is widely used for Test-Driven Development (TDD) and automated testing in the .NET ecosystem.
Framework for managing monorepo style development.

API spec swagger analyzer.
Purpose: OAS diff tools compare two versions of an OpenAPI Specification (OAS) to detect breaking changes or inconsistencies.

Key Features:

Provider-centric: Based on the API spec written by the provider.

Schema comparison: Highlights changes in endpoints, parameters, response formats, etc.

Change detection: Flags breaking changes (e.g., removed fields, changed types).

Validation: Ensures the spec is complete and consistent.

Integration: Often used in CI/CD pipelines to prevent regressions.

Use Case: Best for teams maintaining robust API documentation and wanting to validate changes before deployment.

Project OneFuzz enables continuous developer-driven fuzzing to proactively harden software prior to release. With a single command, which can be baked into CICD, developers can launch fuzz jobs from a few virtual machines to thousands of cores.
OneFuzz is Microsoft’s open-source fuzzing framework that provides Fuzzing-as-a-Service for developers. It automates the process of running fuzz tests—feeding random or malformed inputs to software to uncover security vulnerabilities, crashes, and unexpected behaviors. It’s designed for continuous security testing and integrates easily into CI/CD pipelines like Azure DevOps.

Consumer-Driven Contract Testing
Purpose: Pact is designed for contract testing, focusing on the interaction between a consumer (e.g., frontend) and a provider (e.g., backend API).

Key Features:

Consumer-driven: The consumer defines expectations (requests and expected responses), and the provider must comply.

Specification by example: Contracts are created from actual test cases.

Mocking and verification: Consumers test against mocks; providers verify against the contract.

Version control: Pact Broker helps manage contract versions and compatibility across services.

Language support: Available in many languages (Java, JS, Python, etc.).

Use Case: Ideal for microservices where you want to ensure that changes in one service don’t break others. It’s proactive and test-driven.
Monthly pen tests on delta + Full pen tests every half year.
Infrastructure as Code (IAC) testing framework.
Comprehensive testing from start to finish using Pluralsight resources.

Tools: Pull request validation using Github / Github Copilot PR reviewer
Description:
Validates pull requests to ensure code quality and prevent deployment failures.
Copilot PR review analyzes pull requests and provides feedback and suggested changes.
It uses AI models to review code contextually, focusing on readability, maintainability, and potential issues.
It does not enforce rules or perform formal static analysis like CodeQL; instead, it offers advisory comments similar to a human reviewer.
Copilot reviews do not block merges and are not counted as required approvals.
Product Link: Reviewing a pull request created by GitHub Copilot - GitHub Docs

Description: Qodo (formerly named Codium) is an agentic code integrity / AI coding platform focused on helping developers write, test, and review code with high quality. It integrates AI deeply in the development workflow: IDEs (VS Code, JetBrains plugins, etc.), Git / pull request workflows, CI/CD contexts. Customers are using Qodo alongside GitHub Copilot to help with tasks like automated test generation, context-aware suggestions, and ensure code is enterprise ready and aligned with the company's best practices and guidelines.
Security tool for vulnerability management and compliance.

Continuous inspection of code quality to perform automatic reviews.
SonarQube have now a mcp server

Spectral is an open-source JSON/YAML linter designed for API specifications such as OpenAPI, AsyncAPI, and JSON Schema.
It enforces API style guides, validates specifications, and supports custom rulesets for governance and security.
It integrates with Visual Studio Code (via an extension) and CI/CD pipelines (e.g., GitHub Actions, Azure DevOps).
Microsoft uses Spectral rulesets in Azure API Center for API linting and analysis.

It performs mutation testing, which means it deliberately introduces small changes (mutations) into your source code to check whether your unit tests can detect and fail against those changes.
Stryker.NET offers you mutation testing for your .NET Core and .NET Framework projects. It allows you to test your tests by temporarily inserting bugs. Stryker.NET is installed using NuGet.
Software Engineering Agent that takes a GitHub issue and tries to automatically fix it, using your LM of choice. It can also be employed for offensive cybersecurity or competitive coding challenges.
Uses containerized environments to run integration tests, simulating production conditions.
Linter for Terraform to check for errors and best practices.

Transform your QA process with Thunder Code. AI-powered test automation platform. Create, manage, and run automated tests without coding - perfect for QA teams seeking efficiency, reliability, and seamless integration.
Container scan for vulnerabilities and misconfigurations.
API design tool for defining and generating API specifications.
A C# .NET version based on mock4net which mimics the functionality from the JAVA based WireMock. Used for HTTP response stubbing, mocking web services, and integration testing.

xUnit.net is a free, open-source unit testing framework for .NET applications. It is part of the xUnit family of testing frameworks (like JUnit for Java) and was created by the original author of NUnit to provide a modern, extensible, and community-driven alternative for .NET developers.
Node All-in-one testing framework by Meta, great for React and Node.Built-in mocking, assertions, snapshot testing
Python Popular and powerful with simple syntax. Supports fixtures, parameterized tests, plugins

With Copilot coding agent, GitHub Copilot can work independently in the background to complete tasks, just like a human developer.

Copilot can:

Fix bugs
Implement incremental new features
Improve test coverage
Update documentation
Address technical debt
